body_html: Thanks for the review! I added code to dynamically load a shared library in the way that caffe2 does it. This avoid having to make the user .so Python-specific in any way, and doesn't even require a setup.py at all. I also added a test for using a registered op from a @torch.jit.script-ed function.
body_text: Thanks for the review! I added code to dynamically load a shared library in the way that caffe2 does it. This avoid having to make the user .so Python-specific in any way, and doesn't even require a setup.py at all. I also added a test for using a registered op from a @torch.jit.script-ed function.
body: Thanks for the review! I added code to dynamically load a shared library in the way that caffe2 does it. This avoid having to make the user `.so` Python-specific in any way, and doesn't even require a `setup.py` at all. I also added a test for using a registered op from a `@torch.jit.script`-ed function.
